r-py-cheatsheet

Author

Yann Say

Reading and writing data

Create a dataframe

r_df_example <- data.frame(id = letters[1:6],
numeric = 1:6)
r_df_example
  id numeric
1  a       1
2  b       2
3  c       3
4  d       4
5  e       5
6  f       6
import pandas as pd
py_df_example = pd.DataFrame({'id': list('abcdef'),
                 'numeric': list(range(1, 7))
                })

py_df_example
  id  numeric
0  a        1
1  b        2
2  c        3
3  d        4
4  e        5
5  f        6

palmers

library(palmerpenguins)
library(dplyr)

r_df <- penguins
import seaborn as sns
py_df = sns.load_dataset('penguins')

write csv/xlsx

r_df |> 
  write.csv("penguins.csv")
py_df.to_csv('penguins.csv')

read csv/xlsx

r_df_csv <- read.csv("penguins.csv")
py_df_csv = pd.read_csv("penguins.csv")

Data Exploration

Columns names

names(r_df)
[1] "species"           "island"            "bill_length_mm"   
[4] "bill_depth_mm"     "flipper_length_mm" "body_mass_g"      
[7] "sex"               "year"             
py_df.columns
Index(['species', 'island', 'bill_length_mm', 'bill_depth_mm',
       'flipper_length_mm', 'body_mass_g', 'sex'],
      dtype='object')

Data manipulation

copy of dataframe

How to create 2 independent dataframes. In Python, if you another_df = original_df, each modification of another_df will be reflected in original_df.

another_r_df <- r_df
another_py_df = py_df.copy()

filter

penguins |> 
  filter(species == "Adelie")

filter & select

r_df |> 
  filter(species == "Adelie") |> 
  select("bill_length_mm")
# A tibble: 152 × 1
   bill_length_mm
            <dbl>
 1           39.1
 2           39.5
 3           40.3
 4           NA  
 5           36.7
 6           39.3
 7           38.9
 8           39.2
 9           34.1
10           42

mutate

summarise

r_df |> 
  group_by(species) |> 
  summarise(bill_length_mm = mean(bill_length_mm, na.rm = T))
# A tibble: 3 × 2
  species   bill_length_mm
  <fct>              <dbl>
1 Adelie              38.8
2 Chinstrap           48.8
3 Gentoo              47.5
py_df.groupby('species')['bill_length_mm'].mean().reset_index()
     species  bill_length_mm
0     Adelie       38.791391
1  Chinstrap       48.833824
2     Gentoo       47.504878

# del_ori = flights.groupby('origin')['total_delay', 'dep_delay', 'arr_delay'].agg(['mean', 'std'])
# print(del_ori)

rename

r_df |>
  rename(Species = species,
         Island = island)
# A tibble: 344 × 8

# ℹ 2 more variables: sex <fct>, year <int>
rename_r_df <- r_df[,c("species", "island")]
names(rename_r_df) <- c("Species", "Island")
names(rename_r_df)
[1] "Species" "Island" 
py_df_rename1 = py_df.copy()
py_df_rename1.rename(columns={'species': 'Species', 'island': 'Island'}, inplace=True)

py_df_rename2 = py_df[["species","island"]].copy()
py_df_rename2.columns = ["Species", "Island"]
py_df_rename2.columns
Index(['Species', 'Island'], dtype='object')

arrange

r_df |> 
  arrange(species) |> 
  head()
# A tibble: 6 × 8
  species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g
  <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <int>       <int>

2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186        3800
3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195        3250
4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA                  NA          NA
